dialogue.text: I stop by my room before heading over to the one the second floor girls are staying in to get changed into something more comfortable.
The good thing about this is that it means I won’t be going to sleep in jeans tonight.
The bad thing, however, is that the room is filled with icky girls that I'm going to have to try and talk to.
I make my way into the room with a pep in my step and a dream in my heart.
I take a look around the room to find everyone essentially doing their own thing and am quickly hit with my first dilemma out of what I imagine will be many.
Who am I going to talk to first?
We have all night, so I’m sure I’ll be able to spend at least a {i}little{/i} time with everyone, but...
Well...I guess there’d be even less use in standing around. So I should probably just make a decision now.
Who do I want to talk to?
I make my way over to the Kanda sisters to see how Karin mysteriously wound up reconciling with Kirin over the last several hours.
Umm...hey!
Sup?
Hey. Just figured I’d see what you two were up to on account of the whole “me sleeping in here” thing.
I’m sorry, what was that?
Remember that dorm war thing we had you judge a while ago?
I remember you licking Miku.
Yeah, that one.
Sensei was the prize for that. And since we won, he has to sleep in our room.
But...
But then where will all of you sleep?
Probs on top of him or something. I don’t know.
But...there are so many of you!
Surely he’ll suffocate!
That sounds not only unconventional but just plain weird. I'll sleep in the tub or something.
That aside, what’s going on with you two?
Hm? What’re you talking about?
I mean...didn’t today start off with you being mad at Karin for coming to the beach when you told her not to?
Ahh. Yeah, I guess the morning did start like that.
We’re fine now, though.
Kirin and I are...about to go night swimming.
Having a sister sounds exhausting. That’s too dramatic a change for only several hours passing by.
Eh. It is what it is.
I know I can be kinda hot and cold or whatever. And it’s not like I could stay mad at Karin when she was the one our parents gave the dinner money to.
I...really hope that’s not the only-
Anyway, did you wanna come swimming with us?
We’re both pretty good, but we can pretend we’re not and you could give us lessons or something.
I think that sounds like a load of fun, don’t you, sis?
I’ll just...close my eyes while he teaches you, so...I don’t get jealous.
Ah! Did I say jealous?! I meant...jelly!
Jellyfish! That’s what I was trying to say!
I can’t get swimming lessons because of my...jellyfish allergy!
Oh? I guess more Sensei for me then.
As fun as that sounds, I don’t really think I’m allowed to leave the room.
You’re {i}allowed{/i} to do whatever you want. You’re a grown man.
You’re...really not coming?
Karin, literally two seconds ago you were telling us that you couldn’t even swim because of your alleged jellyfish allergy.
I wasn’t sad two seconds ago...now I am.
Well, if I’m still awake when you guys get back, feel free to come...tell me about it or whatever.
Laaaaaame.
Okay...
Goodnight, Sensei...
Now who do I want to talk to?
